list.name: Changes
list.comment: Implemented numeric validation to recognize comma-separated numbers in the client. Added chart generation functionality for user-selected data ranges in the spreadsheet, supporting both bar and line charts. Users can now select a range of cells for the X-axis and another range for the Y-axis, generating simple X vs. Y visualizations using JavaFX’s built-in charting tools.

task.summary: Default task

changelist.name: Changes
changelist.comment: Starting part 2!!! Some system changes: Mainly in updating a cell using a function: • Input of a function will be considered incorrect only if it is an incorrect structure: unknown function name; Incorrect amount of arguments, etc.). • Input of arguments of the wrong type to the function, either directly (for example: concat(4,5)) or indirectly (for example: in a1 there is a number 4 and then concat(ref(a1),aaa)) is performed - it will be considered a valid input ( that doesn't throw exception) but then the function will get an invalid value (according to its type) • An empty cell has no value. Making a ref to an empty cell is meaningless, but technically it is a valid and proper input. The value of the cell that makes a ref to an empty cell is... the empty cell. -Note: There is one missing case in the "ref" that needs to be addressed

task.summary:
Implemented graph creation feature for numerical data in the sheet.
- Added functionality for generating line and bar charts based on user-selected X and Y axis ranges. - Created error handling for invalid range formats and non-numeric values in the selected cells. - Added detailed validation to ensure the X and Y ranges contain equal numbers of values. - Updated UI to allow users to select cell ranges for graph creation, including new controls for selecting and confirming range input. - Enhanced error messaging for invalid input formats and mismatched value counts between X and Y axis selections. - Documentation and comments added across relevant classes to clarify the graph creation process and error handling mechanisms.

Added minimum window size restrictions to prevent excessive resizing. Updated graph functionality to convert lowercase cell identifiers (e.g., 'a1') to uppercase (e.g., 'A1') for consistency and usability.
- Cleaned up several classes.
final updates before submission

Fixed the handling of Platform.runLater in AppController's loadAndDisplaySheetFromXmlFile method to ensure that UI updates are executed correctly on the JavaFX Application Thread. Added proper lambda syntax for multiple statements.
Improved error handling: The application now properly stops processing if an invalid file or conflicting range is detected during XML file loading. This prevents the application from attempting to display corrupted data after encountering an exception.

Implemented deep copy functionality across multiple components: - Added createDeepCopy method in SheetImpl to handle deep copying of sheets, including copying cells, the range manager, and all related data. - Implemented deep copy for CellImpl, ensuring correct copying of cell dependencies (dependsOn and influencingOn) while avoiding recursion issues with cyclic references. - Added tracking maps in SheetImpl and CellImpl (copiedCells) to prevent infinite recursion during the deep copy process. - Implemented deep copy functionality for RangeImpl and RangeManagerImpl to ensure ranges and their usage counts are copied correctly. - Ensured that all dependent entities such as cells, ranges, and the range manager are copied deeply, maintaining consistency and avoiding shared references between the original and copied sheets.

Implemented deep copy functionality across multiple components: - Added createDeepCopy method in SheetImpl to handle deep copying of sheets, including copying cells, the range manager, and all related data. - Implemented deep copy for CellImpl, ensuring correct copying of cell dependencies (dependsOn and influencingOn) while avoiding recursion issues with cyclic references. - Added tracking maps in SheetImpl and CellImpl (copiedCells) to prevent infinite recursion during the deep copy process. - Implemented deep copy functionality for RangeImpl and RangeManagerImpl to ensure ranges and their usage counts are copied correctly. - Ensured that all dependent entities such as cells, ranges, and the range manager are copied deeply, maintaining consistency and avoiding shared references between the original and copied sheets.
last merge before submit part 2
starting part 3!!!
starting part 3!!! linking the tomcat and dividing it into new models and starting work on login

Implemented unique username validation and login flow for the client
- **Client module**: - Added login flow with `LoginController.java` to handle user input and authentication. - Updated `login.fxml` to define the layout and bind buttons to controller methods. - Created CSS styling in `login.css` for error labels, main action buttons, and quit buttons. - Implemented test classes (`TestLogin.java`, `TestLogin2.java`) for validating login functionality.
- **Engine module**: - Added `UserManager.java` and `UserManagerImpl.java` to handle user management, ensuring that each user has a unique name.
- **Server module**: - `LightweightLoginServlet.java`: Handles basic user login and session creation, ensuring that only unique usernames are allowed. - `LogoutServlet.java`: Manages user logout and session termination. - `ServletUtils.java`: Utility functions for managing user sessions and attributes. - `SessionUtils.java`: Utility functions for session management. - `Constants.java`: Stores constant values used across the application.
- Fixed issues with class loading and servlet integration in the login process.

Prepared FXML and controller structure for dashboard layout
- Created `dashboardHeader.fxml` to define the layout for the header section of the dashboard. - Added `DashboardHeaderController.java` to handle the logic and interaction for the header section. - Organized the project structure under `subcomponents/header` for better modularization. - Added placeholders for subcomponents in the dashboard (availableSheets, commands, and Permissions).

Initial implementation of sheetCellMainController and main FXML for client navigation
- Implemented `sheetCellMainController` to handle the main client logic and navigation between views (login, dashboard, and sheet). - Created the main FXML layout to manage transitions between different screens. - Set up the initial structure for handling view changes dynamically within the client. - Further adjustments and improvements to navigation and layout are needed before finalizing.
fix loadSheet url
fix loadSheet url

Prepared FXML for displaying selected sheet view layout
- Created `selectedSheetView.fxml` to define the layout for displaying the selected sheet. - Added subcomponents: - `selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml` to handle the header section. - `selectedSheetViewLeft.fxml` for the left-side controls (currently placeholders). - `selectedSheet.fxml` for the main sheet display. - Structured the layout to include sections for the available sheets table, permissions table, and commands (view, request permission, acknowledge/deny). - Initial layout setup without implementing functionality or actions.

Implemented SelectedSheetViewHeaderController for handling sheet view header interactions
- Created `SelectedSheetViewHeaderController` to manage user interactions in the header of the selected sheet view. - Added listeners for background color, text color, column width, and row height changes, allowing users to customize cell properties. - Set up initial structure for handling alignment changes (Left, Center, Right) via `ChoiceBox`. - Temporarily disabled certain buttons and controls for future functionality. - Added placeholders for buttons like `BackToDefault`, `LoadFile`, `UpdateValue`, and `VersionSelector` actions (logic to be implemented later). - Implemented bindings to toggle control availability based on selection state.

-Updated SelectedSheetViewController, SelectedSheetViewHeaderController, SelectedSheetViewLeftController, and SelectedSheetController in the client module. - Added detailed documentation for all classes to explain functionality and improve code readability.

-Updated SelectedSheetViewController, SelectedSheetViewHeaderController, SelectedSheetViewLeftController, and SelectedSheetController in the client module. - Added detailed documentation for all classes to explain functionality and improve code readability.
Deleting file upload option from selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml in Client
Deleting file upload option from selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml in Client
add cellServlet to Server
updates after merge
This change allows the main controller to manage and display the SelectedSheetView , Dashboard and login as part of the application flow.
This change allows the main controller to manage and display the SelectedSheetView , Dashboard and login as part of the application flow.
This change allows the main controller to manage and display the SelectedSheetView , Dashboard and login as part of the application flow.

Added handling for cell updates in CellServlet and improved session-based sheet identification. Implemented client-side functionality to send cell update requests.
- Implemented update logic for cells in the CellServlet class, allowing PUT requests to update cell values. - Added session-based retrieval of the current sheet to ensure updates are performed on the correct sheet. - On the client side, created a method to send asynchronous PUT requests with updated cell data. - The client sends coordinate and original value as form parameters in the request body to update the selected cell.

Added feature where, upon a cell update by a client, all other clients viewing the sheet will have a flashing button indicating a new version is available. When they click the button, they are transitioned to the latest version of the sheet. - Implemented polling mechanism to check for sheet updates. - Added flashing button logic for clients when a newer version is detected. - Once clients click the flashing button, they are transitioned to the updated sheet version and the button stops flashing. - Updated SheetPollerTask to handle server polling for new sheet versions and button flashing.

Added feature where, upon a cell update by a client, all other clients viewing the sheet will have a flashing button indicating a new version is available. When they click the button, they are transitioned to the latest version of the sheet. - Implemented polling mechanism to check for sheet updates. - Added flashing button logic for clients when a newer version is detected. - Once clients click the flashing button, they are transitioned to the updated sheet version and the button stops flashing. - Updated SheetPollerTask to handle server polling for new sheet versions and button flashing.

Implemented new cell selection, update functionalities, and skin switching capabilities in the client application: - Added a "Work Bar" to display details for the selected cell: - Displays the identity of the selected cell (e.g., 5A, in uppercase). - Shows the original value of the cell. - Shows the last version in which the cell was updated. - Highlighted the cells that the selected cell relies on with a light blue background. - Highlighted the cells that depend on the selected cell with a light green background.
- Added the ability to adjust the width of columns/rows via the graphical interface: - If the content is larger than the column width, it can either wrap or clip based on the user's choice. - The option is set at the column level and applies to all displayed data in that column.
- Added the option to align the content within columns: - The alignment can be set to left, right, or center. - The option is set at the column level and applies to all displayed data in that column.
- Added the ability to style a specific cell: - The user can select both the background color and text color using a color picker. - Added a dedicated button to reset all styling to the default state. - The styling is attached to the cell and preserved during sorting/filtering actions.
- Implemented the ability for the user to switch between at least two additional color schemes (skins) beyond the default: - Each skin change updates: 1. The background of the entire screen. 2. The appearance of all buttons on the screen. 3. The font style and size of all labels on the screen. - The design for skin switching is functional but still requires improvements to enhance its visual appeal.

Implemented new cell selection, update functionalities, and skin switching capabilities in the client application: - Added a "Work Bar" to display details for the selected cell: - Displays the identity of the selected cell (e.g., 5A, in uppercase). - Shows the original value of the cell. - Shows the last version in which the cell was updated. - Highlighted the cells that the selected cell relies on with a light blue background. - Highlighted the cells that depend on the selected cell with a light green background.

- Added the option to align the content within columns: - The alignment can be set to left, right, or center. - The option is set at the column level and applies to all displayed data in that column.

The appearance of all buttons on the screen. 3. The font style and size of all labels on the screen. - The design for skin switching is functional but still requires improvements to enhance its visual appeal.

Implemented new cell selection, update functionalities, and skin switching capabilities in the client application: - Added a "Work Bar" to display details for the selected cell: - Displays the identity of the selected cell (e.g., 5A, in uppercase). - Shows the original value of the cell. - Shows the last version in which the cell was updated. - Highlighted the cells that the selected cell relies on with a light blue background. - Highlighted the cells that depend on the selected cell with a light green background.
- Added the ability to adjust the width of columns/rows via the graphical interface: - If the content is larger than the column width, it can either wrap or clip based on the user's choice. - The option is set at the column level and applies to all displayed data in that column.
- Added the option to align the content within columns: - The alignment can be set to left, right, or center. - The option is set at the column level and applies to all displayed data in that column.
- Added the ability to style a specific cell: - The user can select both the background color and text color using a color picker. - Added a dedicated button to reset all styling to the default state. - The styling is attached to the cell and preserved during sorting/filtering actions.
- Implemented the ability for the user to switch between at least two additional color schemes (skins) beyond the default: - Each skin change updates: 1. The background of the entire screen. 2. The appearance of all buttons on the screen. 3. The font style and size of all labels on the screen. - The design for skin switching is functional but still requires improvements to enhance its visual appeal.

Implemented range display functionality on the client side and server-side API integration: - Added functionality in the client to fetch and display a selected range from the server. - The client sends a GET request to the /range endpoint, passing the selected range name. - The server responds with a list of cell coordinates (IDs) in JSON format. - The client then highlights the cells in the selected range by adding borders and storing the previously selected cells for clearing.
- Server-side RangeServlet implementation: - The RangeServlet retrieves the list of cell coordinates for the specified range. - Converts the list of coordinates to JSON and returns it as a response. - Added error handling for missing parameters and server issues.
- Added GSON to parse the JSON response from the server into a list of cell IDs in the client. - Ensured client-side handling of successful and failed requests with proper error messaging.

Implemented AllRangesServlet to handle range-related operations: - Added functionality to handle GET requests to retrieve all range names for a given sheet and return them as a JSON response. - Added PUT request handling to create a new range in the sheet using coordinates and range name provided in the request body (JSON format). - Added DELETE request handling to delete a range from the sheet based on the range name provided in the request body (JSON format). - Included helper method to convert a list of DTORange objects to a list of range names. - Integrated session validation to ensure unauthorized users or sheets are blocked.

Commit: Refactored AllRangesServlet + Added range addition, deletion, and real-time polling for range updates in the client
- Refactored AllRangesServlet to handle range-related requests more efficiently. - Implemented client-side functionality to show, add and delete ranges. Introduced polling mechanism for real-time range updates. - Created RangePollerTask that polls the server every 5 seconds to check for changes in the range list. - The choice boxes in the UI are updated automatically when a range is added or removed by any client sharing the same sheet.
This commit introduces the ability for multiple clients working on the same sheet to see real-time updates to the ranges.

fix: Handle NaN and UNKNOWN values in EffectiveValueAdapter
- Added logic to handle "NaN" for numeric cell types in EffectiveValueAdapter's write and read methods. - Added logic to handle "UNKNOWN" for boolean cell types in EffectiveValueAdapter's write and read methods. - Fixed the issue where ClassCastException was being thrown when casting unexpected values. - Ensured that empty cells are represented as empty strings.
change polling class

Added feature to track and display the user who updated each cell. Updated modules : Engine, DataTransferObject (DTO, JSON), Client, and Server to handle and display the username of the user who made direct or indirect changes to a cell. The information about the user is now shown in the third screen's action bar when selecting a specific cell.

Added dynamic analysis feature to sheet application
Implemented DynamicAnalysisServlet to handle temporary cell updates for dynamic analysis. These updates are used for background calculations and are not persisted in the final sheet. Added logic in DynamicAnalysisSheetController to interact with dynamic analysis sliders and send temporary values to the server. Updated SelectedSheetViewController and SelectedSheetViewLeftController to process and display temporary changes from dynamic analysis without saving them. Extended CellImpl and SheetImpl classes to manage the temporary updates to cells and rollback the original values after analysis. Modified SheetManagerImpl to handle dynamic analysis requests and updates between the frontend and backend.

Implemented version check to prevent cell updates on outdated sheet versions. Users must switch to the latest version to update cell values. If not on the latest version, a warning message is displayed, guiding the user to use the switch button.
Made some adjustments to the design and layout.

Handled client closure to ensure all background tasks and timers are stopped upon exiting the application. This resolves the 'executor rejected' errors that occurred when the window was closed without stopping ongoing polling tasks.

Handled client closure to ensure all background tasks and timers are stopped upon exiting the application. This resolves the 'executor rejected' errors that occurred when the window was closed without stopping ongoing polling tasks.
Added version check for range removal: If the user is not on the latest sheet version, they receive a notification explaining they cannot delete a range until updating to the latest version

"Implemented notification for latest version check: If a client is already on the latest sheet version and attempts to update, they receive a message indicating no further update is needed. Additionally, ensured consistent styling updates across client main views to maintain uniform appearance

Implemented numeric validation to recognize comma-separated numbers in the client. Added chart generation functionality for user-selected data ranges in the spreadsheet, supporting both bar and line charts. Users can now select a range of cells for the X-axis and another range for the Y-axis, generating simple X vs. Y visualizations using JavaFX’s built-in charting tools.
